What are the genetic changes related to very long-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase deficiency ?,"Mutations in the ACADVL gene cause VLCAD deficiency. This gene provides instructions for making an enzyme called very long-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase, which is required to break down (metabolize) a group of fats called very long-chain fatty acids.
